title: Ticket #3989: Abort-dag-on return value other than 0, 1, or 2 keeps DAGMan queued
description: Because of the on_exit_remove expression generated by condor_submit_dag, if a condor_dagman returns an exit code other than 0, 1, or 2, it will remain in the queue and be re-run, as opposed to exiting the queue with failure. Especially for sub-DAGs, this may be a confusing behavior. I'm not sure whether we should change it (I don't remember the original reasons for the on_exit_remove expression, and we should probably figure that out before changing things), but this behavior should at least be documented.
